title: chore: update rusqlite
body: This allows users of deno to use a more recent version.

title: fix(ext/ffi): enforce unstable check on ops
fix: deprecate URL as the first arg of fetch
body: Deno's fetch and lib.dom's fetch have slightly different declarations. (Deno's fetch accept URL as the first arg, but lib.dom's fetch doesn't) We should align Deno's declaration to lib.dom's (spec defines first arg as `typedef (Request or USVString) RequestInfo` [ref](https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#requestinfo)) to reduce the confusion. This PR tries to deprecate Deno-only signature of fetch function. With this change, fetch with URL call gets strikethrough style in vscode like the below

title: feat(core): disableable extensions & ops
body:
Streamlines a common middleware pattern and provides foundations for avoiding variably sized v8::ExternalReferences & enabling fully monomorphic op callpaths

Op middleware has the final say on whether an op is enabled/disabled/overridden, otherwise the logic is:
```
op.enabled = extension.enabled && op.enabled;
```

Entire extensions can be enabled/disabled, individual ops can also toggled in the extension constructor.

Main semi-open question is if disabled ops should throw or just no-op by mapping to `op_void_a?sync` thus returning `undefined` (no-op-ing is our current behaviour so I'm going to stick with that)

title: fix(core): variadic opSync/opAsync
body: To allow opcalls with more than 2 generic-args JS-side

title: perf(http): avoid per header alloc
body:
When checking if header matches a "special" header (that impacts our body handling, etc...)

[make_ascii_lowercase](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/string/struct.String.html#method.make_ascii_lowercase) could also make sense here

### Impact on throughput

Unfortunately there's a lot of variance in our tests and it's not fully formalized but I do observe a 1-3% improvement in throughput (sampled over 3 runs):

```
Before (1.20.1)
Requests/sec: 126285.80
Requests/sec: 127775.95
Requests/sec: 128875.33

After (this PR):
Requests/sec: 130615.10
Requests/sec: 129957.80
Requests/sec: 129056.16
```

title: cleanup(core): drop op_void_async's state arg
body: Since OpState-like args are optional since: https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/13954

title: chore(fetch, mimesniff): Refactor the "extract a MIME type" algorithm
body:
`Request.prototype[_mimesniff]` and `Response.prototype[_mimesniff]` are functions that implement the "extract a MIME type" algorithm from the fetch spec. These implementations are the same line by line, though. This change deduplicates that by moving most of the implementation to a `extractMimeType` function under `ext/web`'s `01_mimesniff.js`, and simply calling that with the decoded and split headers from the `[_mimesniff]` functions.

Closes #14002.

title: chore(core,ext): Minor JS optimisations
body:
Some exceedingly minor JS optimisations:
1. Avoid creating N objects when initialising `opIds` where N is the number of ops. 1 object will do.
2. Avoid a few other unnecessary object spreads, one in `Datagram.prototype.send` and another in a webidl `makeException` call. There are quite a bit more of object spreads around here that I would like to take a stab at, replacing object spreads with explicit option picking but that shall wait for a better day.
3. Remove `opts` parameter usage from webidl `toNumber` helper function as unused.

title: fix(core): Don't override structured clone error messages from V8
body:
In the implementation of structured serialization in `Deno.core.serialize`, whenever there is a serialization error, an exception will be thrown with the message "Failed to serialize response", even though V8 provides a message to use in such cases. This change instead throws an exception with the V8-provided message, if there is one.

Closes #13932.

title: fix(fetch): Fix uncaught rejection panic with `WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming`
body:
When an exception is thrown during the processing of streaming WebAssembly, `op_wasm_streaming_abort` is called. This op calls into V8, which synchronously rejects the promise and calls into the promise rejection handler, if applicable. But calling an op borrows the isolate's `JsRuntimeState` for the duration of the op, which means it is borrowed when V8 calls into `promise_reject_callback`, which tries to borrow it again, panicking.

This change changes `op_wasm_streaming_abort` from an op to a binding (`Deno.core.abortWasmStreaming`). Although that binding must borrow the `JsRuntimeState` in order to access the `WasmStreamingResource` stored in the `OpTable`, it also takes ownership of that `WasmStreamingResource` instance, which means it can drop any borrows of the `JsRuntimeState` before calling into V8.

Fixes #13917.

```

  Time (mean ± σ):      90.1 ms ±   1.3 ms    [User: 90.1 ms, System: 7.9 ms]

After:

```

﻿Closes #10978.

title: feat(task): log task script
body:
Logs task name and associated script with additional args. 
This is disabled if "--quiet/-q" flag is present.

```
// before:
$ deno task exit_code_5 
10
// after:
$ deno task exit_code_5
Task exit_code_5 echo $(echo 10 ; exit 2) && exit 5
10
```

title: chore(test): fix flaky tasks
body: The tasks were flaky. Now it's been rewritten to use os pipes so when it writes to stdout it will write directly to that pipe instead of through a series of tokio channels.

title: fix(ext/crypto): handle JWK import with "use"
body: fixes #13911

title: chore: update rusty_v8 to 0.41.0
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

title: refactor(core): validate promise id in refOp
body:
This PR adds the wrappers of the existing `core.refOp` and `core.unrefOp`, and checks if the given promise ids are valid.

Currently we don't check whether the promise id is valid or not. If a wrong promise id is given to `core.unrefOp`, that id remains in pending_ops vector, and causes the exit condition incorrect (Deno program can exit with valid ops still remaining).

---
This implements the idea by @andreubotella in the comment https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/12889#discussion_r756966729

title: chore: fix file permissions of release scripts
body: This PR changes the file permissions of release scripts from `644` to `755`, and make them executable

body: Fixes #13897.

title: fix(ext/crypto): use EcKeyImportParams dictionary
body:
as per https://w3c.github.io/webcrypto/#webidl-410131068

currently, universal code referencing the `EcKeyImportParams` interface doesn't work

```
Uncaught TypeError: TS2304 [ERROR]: Cannot find name 'EcKeyImportParams'
```

title: chore: reduce release PRs from 2 to 1
body:
1. Reduces the number of PRs necessary for doing a release from 2 to 1.
2. It filters out commits for minor releases that were already in a patch.

Closes #13873

title: perf(core): micro-optimize OpsTracker
body:
Relative to #13864

```
Before:
test bench_is_proxy   ... bench:      20,292 ns/iter (+/- 480)
test bench_op_async   ... bench:     385,609 ns/iter (+/- 5,775)
test bench_op_nop     ... bench:      46,042 ns/iter (+/- 1,785)
test bench_op_pi_json ... bench:      49,903 ns/iter (+/- 668)

After:
test bench_is_proxy   ... bench:      20,428 ns/iter (+/- 1,292)
test bench_op_async   ... bench:     386,556 ns/iter (+/- 6,006)
test bench_op_nop     ... bench:      44,772 ns/iter (+/- 1,313)
test bench_op_pi_json ... bench:      48,357 ns/iter (+/- 1,299)
```

Yes, it's only ~1.5ns but that will be 5% of sync-op overhead following #13861

title: fix(ext/http): drop content-length header on compression
body:
Fixes the following panic. Hyper updates the content-length header based on body but panics if user provides a content-length header and it doesn't match. Which is the case when we apply compression and user provides a content-length header based on the uncompressed body.

```
Deno has panicked. This is a bug in Deno. Please report this
at https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/new.
If you can reliably reproduce this panic, include the
reproduction steps and re-run with the RUST_BACKTRACE=1 env
var set and include the backtrace in your report.

Platform: macos aarch64
Version: 1.19.2
Args: ["/Users/sr/c/github.com/denoland/deno/target/debug/deno", "run", "-A", "main.ts"]

thread 'main' panicked at 'payload claims content-length of 81, custom content-length header claims 70', /Users/sr/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/hyper-0.14.16/src/proto/h1/role.rs:651:37
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```
